Model.Game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Game.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the board that the game is played on. The actual field with tiles is a Map with Locations and Tiles. There are methods to alter that field, like making a move, and to get information from it, like getting possible moves. Created by Martijn on 11-1-2016.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Map<Location,Tile> field
      The actual field with all the tiles and their location.

    • Method Detail

      • getField

        public java.util.Map<Location,Tile> getField()
        Returns the field.
        Returns:
        This board's field.

      • makePutMove

        public void makePutMove(PutMove move)
        Makes a put move on the board. This method does NOT check the validity of the move.
        Parameters:
        move - The move to be made.

      • getPossibleMoves

        public java.util.Map<Location,java.util.List<Tile>> getPossibleMoves()
        Creates a Map with a Location and a List of Tiles. The Locations are open spaces in the field where a Tile could be placed. For every Location in the Map a List of Tiles is created that contains all Tiles that could be placed there. If a Location yields an empty List, the Location is not included in the Map.
        Returns:
        A Map with a Location and a List of Tiles that can be placed on that Location.

      • checkId

        public java.util.List<Tile> checkId(java.util.List<Tile> list,
                           java.util.List<Tile> tiles,
                           Identity identity,
                           int id,
                           int step)
        Checks all ID's of Tiles with a certain identity if they are in tiles. If not, they will be added to list.
        Parameters:
        list - List of possible Tiles for a certain Location on the board.
        tiles - List of Tiles that are in a line on the board.
        id - ID of the identity of the Tile concerned.
        step - Step taken by for loop that is determined by the identity.
        Returns:
        A list with usable Tiles.

      • getIdentity

        public Identity getIdentity(java.util.List<Tile> line)
        Checks all Tiles in a List and determines its identity.
        Parameters:
        line - List of Tiles to be checked.
        Returns:
        Identity of List of Tiles.

      • createLine

        public java.util.List<Tile> createLine(Axis axis,
                              Location location,
                              Location startPoint,
                              int step)
        Creates a List of Tiles that are on one line on a certain axis. The Location startPoint is not included. This method uses recursion to create the List. On the first call to this method, the step should be positive (1).
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis on which the line lies.
        location - The location checked in this iteration of the method.
        startPoint - The start location of the method. This location is the reference point.
        step - The step taken on the line to the next location. Must be either 1 or -1.
        Returns:
        A list of Tiles that lie on one line. The Location startPoint is not included.

      • getOpenLocations

        public java.util.List<Location> getOpenLocations()
        Creates a List of all empty Locations adjacent to used Locations. If the field is empty, it will return a list with only one Location with coordinates (0, 0). This List is used to determine possible moves.
        Returns:
        A List of all empty Locations adjacent to used Locations.

      • lowerBound

        public Location lowerBound(Axis axis,
                  java.util.Map<Location,Tile> map)
        Gives the Location with the lowest X or Y depending on the parameter, axis, from a Location to Tile Map. This is done using bubblesort, since N <= 108, making bubblesort sufficiently efficient.
        Parameters:
        axis - Determines whether the Location with the lowest X or Y is returned.
        map - The Map where the Location is returned from.
        Returns:
        Location with lowest X/Y

      • higherBound

        public Location higherBound(Axis axis,
                   java.util.Map<Location,Tile> map)
        Gives the Location with the highest X or Y depending on the parameter, axis, from a Location to Tile Map. This is done using bubblesort, since N <= 108, making bubblesort sufficiently efficient.
        Parameters:
        axis - Determines whether the Location with the highest X or Y is returned.
        map - The Map where the Location is returned from.
        Returns:
        Location with highest X/Y

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a string representation of the field that can be used in a TUI. This format will work as long as the coordinates do not enter triple digits. Considering there are only 108 tiles, this should not be a problem.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the field.

      • startRow

        private java.lang.String startRow(int i)
        Creates a String that is used at the start of a row that represents the Y axis.
        Parameters:
        i - Coordinate on the Y axis.
        Returns:
        The coordinate on the Y axis in a proper format.

      • bottomRow

        private java.lang.String bottomRow(int i)
        Creates a String that is used as the bottom row that represents the X axis.
        Parameters:
        i - Coordinate on the X axis.
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the X axis in the proper format.
